discover.instruction: Read what people said and how it's reported. Notice the changes.
discover.instruction_ru: Прочитай, что люди сказали и как это передаётся. Обрати внимание на изменения.

content.text:
Direct: 'I <highlight>am</highlight> tired,' said Tom.
Reported: Tom said he <highlight>was</highlight> tired.

Direct: 'I <highlight>will</highlight> call you,' she promised.
Reported: She promised she <highlight>would</highlight> call me.

Direct: 'I <highlight>have finished</highlight>,' he announced.
Reported: He announced he <highlight>had finished</highlight>.

Direct: 'I <highlight>can</highlight> help,' Maria offered.
Reported: Maria offered that she <highlight>could</highlight> help.

Direct: 'I <highlight>live</highlight> here,' she explained.
Reported: She explained that she <highlight>lived</highlight> there.
content.question: What happens to the verb tenses when we report what someone said?
content.question_ru: Что происходит с временами глаголов, когда мы передаём чьи-то слова?

points.rule: Present → Past: am/is → was, are → were
points.rule_ru: Настоящее → Прошедшее: am/is → was, are → were
points.example: 'I am happy' → He said he was happy.

points.rule: Present Simple → Past Simple: work → worked
points.rule_ru: Present Simple → Past Simple: work → worked
points.example: 'I work here' → She said she worked there.

points.rule: Present Continuous → Past Continuous: am working → was working
points.rule_ru: Present Continuous → Past Continuous: am working → was working
points.example: 'I am studying' → He said he was studying.

points.rule: Present Perfect → Past Perfect: have done → had done
points.rule_ru: Present Perfect → Past Perfect: have done → had done
points.example: 'I have finished' → She said she had finished.

points.rule: will → would, can → could, may → might
points.rule_ru: will → would, can → could, may → might
points.example: 'I will help' → He said he would help.

points.rule: Pronouns and time/place words also change
points.rule_ru: Местоимения и слова времени/места тоже меняются
points.example: I → he/she, here → there, today → that day, tomorrow → the next day

notice.instruction: Identify what changed in each reported sentence.
notice.instruction_ru: Определи, что изменилось в каждом косвенном предложении.

tasks.text:
At the meeting, several people spoke:

John: 'I am working on a new project.'
→ John said he was working on a new project.

Sarah: 'We have completed the analysis.'
→ Sarah announced that they had completed the analysis.

Mike: 'I will present the results tomorrow.'
→ Mike mentioned he would present the results the next day.

Lisa: 'The team can finish on time.'
→ Lisa believed the team could finish on time.

Boss: 'I need these reports today.'
→ The boss said he needed those reports that day.

notice.reflection_question: Why do we shift tenses back when reporting speech?
notice.reflection_question_ru: Почему мы сдвигаем времена назад при передаче речи?

produce.instruction: Report what different people said in a conversation or meeting.
produce.instruction_ru: Передай, что сказали разные люди в разговоре или на собрании.
prompts: Report a conversation you had recently
Report what your family members said
Report news you heard or read
Report what your teacher or boss said
produce.example: I had an interesting conversation with my friend yesterday. She said she was thinking about changing jobs. She explained that she had been working at the same company for five years. She told me she felt stuck and wanted new challenges. She mentioned she would start looking for new opportunities the next week. I said I understood how she felt. I promised I would help her with her CV. She thanked me and said I was a good friend.

texts.title: The Interview
texts.content: After the job interview, Maria told me everything. She said the interviewer had been very friendly. He had asked about her experience and she had explained that she had worked in marketing for three years. She mentioned that she was currently looking for new challenges. The interviewer said he was impressed with her portfolio. He told her the team was looking for someone creative. He promised he would call her the next week. Maria said she felt confident about the position.

texts.title: News Report
texts.content: The Prime Minister gave a speech yesterday. He said the economy was improving. He explained that unemployment had decreased by 2%. He mentioned that his government had invested in education. He promised they would continue to support businesses. Critics responded immediately. The opposition leader said she didn't believe the figures. She argued that many families were still struggling. She claimed the government had failed to help ordinary people.

texts.title: Gossip
texts.content: Did you hear about Tom and Lisa? My friend told me they had broken up! She said Lisa had told her that Tom never had time for her. Apparently, Tom said he was too busy with work. Lisa explained she had tried to talk to him many times. Tom admitted he had neglected the relationship. He said he would change, but Lisa replied it was too late. She told him she had made her decision. What a sad story!

texts.title: Doctor's Advice
texts.content: I visited the doctor last week. She said I needed to exercise more. She explained that my blood pressure was a bit high. She recommended that I should reduce salt in my diet. She told me I had to stop smoking immediately. She said it would make a big difference. She mentioned that she had seen many patients improve with lifestyle changes. She promised she would check my progress in a month. I said I would follow her advice.

texts.title: Parent-Teacher Meeting
texts.content: The teacher spoke to us about our son. She said he was a bright student. She explained that he had been doing well in most subjects. However, she mentioned that his math grades had dropped recently. She said she had noticed he was often distracted in class. She recommended that we should help him with homework. She told us she believed he could improve. We said we would talk to him at home. She promised she would give him extra support.
